entries.name: create(basename="", tmpdir=nil, mode: 0, **options)
entries.desc: Creates a temporary file as usual File object (not Tempfile). It doesn't use finalizer and delegation.

entries.name: new(basename="", tmpdir=nil, mode: 0, **options)
entries.desc: Creates a temporary file with permissions 0600 (= only readable and writable by the owner) and opens it with mode “w+”.

entries.name: close(unlink_now=false)
entries.desc: Closes the file. If unlink_now is true, then the file will be unlinked (deleted) after closing. Of course, you can choose to later call unlink if you do not unlink it now.

entries.name: close!()
entries.desc: Closes and unlinks (deletes) the file. Has the same effect as called close(true).

entries.name: open()
entries.desc: Opens or reopens the file with mode “r+”.

entries.name: path()
entries.desc: Returns the full path name of the temporary file. This will be nil if unlink has been called.

entries.name: size()
entries.desc: Returns the size of the temporary file.  As a side effect, the IO buffer is flushed before determining the size.

entries.name: unlink()
entries.desc: Unlinks (deletes) the file from the filesystem. One should always unlink the file after using it, as is explained in the “Explicit close” good practice section in the Tempfile overview:
